author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: فِيهِ كُلُّ عالِمٍ وَتَحَيَّرَ كُلُّ عارِفٍ إِلاَّ مَنْ تَقَرَّبَ بِحَوْلِكَ وَأَخَذَ رَحِيْقَ وَحْيِكَ مِنْ يَدِ فَضْلِكَ وَشَرِبَ بِاسْمِكَ وَقالَ لَكَ الحَمْدُ يا مَقْصُودَ العالَمِين
translation: Thou art, O my God and the Exultation of my heart, the One Who hath adorned Thy Tablet, of which none is aware except Thee, with the mention of this Day which Thou didst call after Thy name, that haply none may on that day be seen save Thy most august Self, and naught else be brought to mind except Thy most sweet remembrance.
